description: On both intersections at Babcock and Comm Ave, the light setup creates a dangerous situation for pedestrians. The first problem is that going east and west had a right green arrow, which unnecessary. It exacerbates the second problem, which is that there is no pedestrian light (for pedestrians going east-west along Comm Ave). What results is that pedestrians are forced to walk across when traffic has a green right turn arrow, which encourages the cars to not slow down. It's unsafe -- I almost got hit by a truck today, which is why I'm submitting this despite working on this block for almost five years now.

status_notes: Case Resolved. Dear Constituent,. The Boston Public Works Department Construction Inspection Unit (CIU) has identified the sidewalk left in asphalt as belonging to National Grid. Sidewalks are required to be restored within 60 days. The Public Works had a moratorium on all concrete pour work beginning in late November through April 11th. This sidewalk  location is required to be restored to concrete by no later than June 11th. The location has been entered into the CIU data base that tracks repairs to be made by utility companies or private contractors. If at anytime the asphalt patch becomes unacceptable National Grid will be required to make repairs. The CIU will monitor the progress of the repair. Mark Cardarelli. Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance. Boston Public Works Department. 617-635-4951 Office.

status_notes: Case Resolved. Dear Constituent,. The PWD Roadway Repair Contractor is working on your street performing patch paving.  It is an important city service for your neighborhood to provide the best permanent repairs of previous utility excavations or potholes. The construction process is to dig out 6.5 inches of material and place 5 inches of dense binder hot mix asphalt in 2 lifts. The dense binder gives the patch its strength but is has large stones and is not conducive to providing a smooth ride, the contractor usually within a week comes back and places 1.5 inches of the top course. The top course is hot mix asphalt that provides the smooth ride. What you observed was the patch down in binder awaiting the final top course. The patches are scheduled to be topped within a week.  Any questions you call the City Engineer Tom Mougamian. 617-304-7308.  I hope the explanation clarified your concerns. The city apologizes for the inconvenience this necessary work has caused. Sincerely,.  Mark Cardarelli. Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance. Boston Public Works Department. 617-635-4951 Office.

We as a neighborhood association will be having the city monitor the pollution levels. But wouldn't an easy solution be to have signs up with alternative routes. If it's spelled out and the sign specifically says there will be stand still traffic all the way down the street maybe then people would seek another way to go. There are three other ways. I thought the definition of a crazy person is when they do the same thing more then three times. These people idle their car in stand still traffic every day!  Please advise thanks!

description:
What seems like almost all of the sidewalk corners in my neighborhood are being redone with new handicapped ramps, which is long overdue. However, of the ones that have been completed, almost all of them have been done extremely poorly. A large number have, like the one in the picture, been installed with little or in some cases no grade on the actual sidewalk, and to compensate the workers have created little "ramps" out of asphalt from the street to the sidewalk level. This is going to result in insufficient storm drainage. Many of these corners already havethe problem of "lakes" forming when it rains because of poor repaving jobs in the recent past.

This is terrible work. I'm a layman and I noticed the problem within seconds. If this were my property I would make the contractor do the work over because it's not right. Unfortunately this is city property so the only thing I can do is complain and hope the city fines the contractor, or makes them redo the work until it's right.
address: Intersection Of Auckland St & Belfort St, Dorchester
